title: HR Structure Including Names & Job Titles

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I hope you are well?
I would be grateful if you could provide me with the following information, under the Freedom of Information Act:
• The current name of the Director of Human Resources
• The current name of the Head of Human Resources
• The current names of all the HR Business Partners
• The current names of the Officers responsible for Permanent Executive recruitment tenders/proposals
• The current name of the Head of Procurement
• Do you have a preferred supplier framework for Permanent Executive Recruitment
I would be grateful if could provide these details to me within the 20 day allotted timescales
Yours faithfully,
Stacey Kemp

Dear Stacey Kemp,
Thank you for your request for information relating to HR Structure which
we received on 27/10/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 24/11/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Stacey Kemp,
Thank you for your request for information relating to HR Structure which
we received on 27/10/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Question 1:
1. The current name of the Director of Human Resources
2. The current name of the Head of Human Resources
3. The current names of all the HR Business Partners
4. The current names of the Officers responsible for Permanent Executive
recruitment tenders/proposals
5. The current name of the Head of Procurement
Please see the following link for information regarding our management
teams: [1]Sheffield City Council management teams | Sheffield City Council
The information you have requested relating to officer names, other than
that listed at the above link, is exempt from disclosure under section
40(2) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 on the grounds that it is
personal data and disclosure would contravene the data protection
principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation
that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
Question 2:
6. Do you have a preferred supplier framework for Permanent Executive
Recruitment
Answer: We have a centralised recruitment team, who carry out recruitment
advertising and executive search hire on behalf of service leads. We also
have an overall Managed Service Provider for agency council staff which is
Reed Specialist Recruitment Ltd. The contract commenced in September 2009
and is due to end on 31/3/2024. Also, we have a direct contract with Reed
Consultancy+
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
